sentence: US stocks pointed to moderate gains ahead of opening bell Wednesday as upbea t earnings from Dow component companies like United Technologies ( UTX ) and Procter & Gamble ( PG ) boosted sentiment, overshadowing concerns of a global economic slowdown.

Oil prices nudged higher after a sharp retreat from the previous session with global benchmark Brent crude up 1.06% and US West Texas Intermediate crude up 0.41% recently after official data suggested a slowdown in US shale output.

At 9 am, data are expected to show a 0.3% increase in the Federal Housing Finance Agency house price index for the month of November, which represents a steady gain from the previous month, according to data compiled by Econoday.
At 10 am, forecasters see the Richmond Fed manufacturing index report coming in at -3 for January following a -8 level in December.

In equities, shares of Soligenix ( SNGX ) were 26% higher pre-bell after the European Patent Office granted a new patent for the company's dusquetide and other related innate defense regulator analogs.

(+) ATHX (+22.3%) Reports positive results from study of multistem cell therapy for ARDS patients

(+) RIGL (+10.4%) Enters into collaboration and license agreement with Grifols SA to commercialize Fostamatinib in Europe

(-) PTPT (-7.6%) Starts raising up to $230 million in share offering
